summary: This is a court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Massachusetts Registry of Vital Records and Statistics, commanding its appearance to produce birth records for an unnamed individual in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The subpoena was issued as part of the criminal prosecution against Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual who is the subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which the subpoena is issued.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney who signed and issued the subpoena on behalf of the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is prosecuting the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for Records Production
events.description: The Massachusetts Registry of Vital Records and Statistics is commanded to appear in court to produce birth records for the Maxwell case.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The subpoena was issued and signed by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss.

locations: Registry of Vital Records and Statistics, 150 Mt. Vernon Street, 1st Floor, Dorchester, MA 02125
United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenaed birth records from Massachusetts as part of the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal prosecution.
The subpoena demands the production of birth records for an individual whose name is redacted in the document.
Failure to comply with the subpoena would constitute contempt of court and subject the recipient to sanctions and penalties.
The subpoena was issued by then-U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss in July 2021 for a November 2021 court appearance.
